user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content:
I really enjoy multi-sticks, and with all the brands coming out with their version, it can be hard to compete. I’m giving this product three stars because it has some pros and cons. Ilia is a great clean brand, I highly recommend them. However, I was hoping for more with this multi stick. Literally...more. The stick is pretty small for the price. And even though it will last forever, I was hoping to get more for my money. Beautiful color and pigmentation, but you wanna know the one thing I just can’t get past???? The smell. I only use this on my cheeks because the thought of using it on my lips kind of grossed me out because of the smell. It’s so chemical scented, there is absolutely nothing appealing about it. I’d have been happier if it had no scent at all. I didn’t expect it to be fruity or anything. Plus, when you put it on your lips it doesn’t moisturize, it simply tints. So plan on putting something on underneath. I don’t know, I wouldn’t invest in this until they change the formula... because that smell really makes it not worth it.

review_title: Good, if it's what you're looking for
review_content:
It's nearly impowssible to find a cream blush and this was just about the only option in my Sephora store. When I tried it on it looked just like what I was hoping to find, but unfortunately the lighting in the store distorts colors.and the next day in natural light, it had an orange cast to it. I wanted pink, but it isn't horribly orange and I apply a light layer of what's left of a (discontinued) pink-colored blush stick on top of it. This ILIA blush is very light and sheer and one application isn't enough to make much of a difference, so be prepared to use up more of it than you might expect. Plus it's a short little stubby stick, unlike other stick blushes I've purchased over the years, so you get far less product.

review_content: I loved the softness of this color when i swatched it on my hand in store. However when i used it at home on my face it had weak pigment and a waxy smell and feel. It was dry, tugging on my skin as I swiped it on instead of gliding over the surface. I was disappointed because it looked beautiful and delicate on my hand in store. I will probably return it.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: I’ve been hesitant to buy another cream blush after falling in love with one from Natasha Denona, but I think I found a new favorite! Ultra soft and the color At Last is so subtle but beautiful . AND it’s super easy to blend out

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: I bought this a while ago but have recently realized it’s crept up to can’t-live-without status. My everyday look is pretty natural and this shade is perfect for my skin (Asian, medium to light complexion). I always use it on “no makeup” days for both lips and cheeks, and sometimes eyes. Great to throw in my bag to add some color on-the-go. Love the clean ingredients.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
Wow! I'm surprised I love this as much as I do. It applies beautifully with fingers to the cheeks and seems to melt into skin to give a dewy finish. I am a classic full-pigment lipstick type of person and don't usually use products like this on my lips, so I was shocked to discover that I LOVE swiping this multistick all over my lips as well! The colour A Fine Romance is beautiful - like a lovely flushed shade for fall and winter. The product just sort of smells like natural botanicals, which I really love but might bother some people with an aversion to scent. I will probably purchase more of these.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: Beautiful Color But Not Worth The Price
review_content: I bought the shade Tenderly and while I love the color I think this product is super overpriced. I would really only suggest this to those that care about using clean beauty products. You can get so much more bang for you buck from other brands (especially Milk) so I'd really pay attention to the ounce/grams in all these stick products.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Gray', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: Pretty nice and a good color for light skin
review_content: I like this stick ~ it has a hint of shimmer and looks pretty on cheeks alone, or on both cheeks

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: Hydrating gorgeous cream blush, not sticky
review_content:
Reasons I bought this cream blush: - I am over 50 and have drier skin. Powder blush accentuates fine lines on my cheeks when I smile. I need a cream blush. - I want a cream blush that doesn’t feel sticky and doesn’t dry out quickly either. - this blush hydrates my cheeks but is not greasy. It is easy to apply with fingers or with a synthetic brush, or a beautyblender. - the shade, a fine romance (berry) gives my cheeks a healthy flush, as if I had just returned from a long run.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: natural dewy flush in a stick
review_content:
Dreamer is a great warm brownish rose that is easily blendable and buildable. I love how you can go from a sheer to bright flush and it leaves you perfectly dewy and not oily (and it doesn’t contain coconut oil, which I try to avoid on the face). Someone else said it leaves you “plump” and I concur! It seems to wear differently on the eyes, lips, and cheeks, so if you use it on all points, your face doesn’t look too washed with the same color. Smell is not the greatest but barely noticeable to me and worth it since it’s a “clean” product. Although it is on the pricier side, it really is a great size multi use product to throw in a bag for no fuss flush on the go. Packaging is sleek and sturdy.
…read more

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I wanted to like this. The color is actually really nice and is one of the very few cream blushes that doesn’t have shimmer. But.... when they say it will give a dewy finish, what they mean is “you will look like you have been sweating for 3 days and haven’t washed your face.” This stuff is OILY. It felt like I was rubbing sticky overnight cream on my cheeks! And, oddly, I found the formula hard to blend. The pigment seemed to clump up in areas. Maybe because of the peach fuzz on my cheeks? Whatever the reason, this got returned immediately. My oily skin doesn’t need any help from this blush. I would have given only 1 star, but the color was really nice. Maybe if you have dry skin this could work for you.

review_content: This is a great product. Stays put on lips and cheeks and gives a very natural, flushed look.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: I love this multi-stick. Colours are beautiful with great saturation and it layers beautifully for a natural glow. Simple to apply, just make sure you heat it up with your fingers so it blends effortlessly. I am now ordering my third and forth colour! I’m pretty picky and have a tone of experience with product. This one is excellent.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Spell On You too dark for light skin
review_content: So while the Tenderly is too light and chalky, I Put A Spell On You seems too dark for my pale skin. I would like to try it in again, but it looked like a bronzer that leans orange, not a nice apricot version of a classic more natural pink blush. (And no one would ever want a cream bronzer for obvious reasons): Photo—Top: Tenderly, Bottom: I Put A Spell On You

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Tenderly as a blush is chalky
review_content: The pigment of Tenderly is strange for cheeks. Rather than just pink pigment it seems to be pink and white so it can’t go on sheer or build. You either can’t really see it, or it looks chalky. And I’m very pale, so I can’t imagine that it would look better in a darker skin tone but maybe? Photos—Top: Tenderly, Bottom: I Put a Spell on You

In the photo— Top Left: Color Haze Multi-Use Pigment in Sing, Bottom Right: At Last

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Almost gave it up, until I learned how to apply it
review_content: I grew to like this product. At first I was applying to my face and lightly spreading it out with my fingers. Because it doesn't spread easily, the motion of spreading it was removing make up underneith. I was going to give it away but then I saw a beauty vlogger applying a similar product with a stipple brush. I tried it and that method works beautifully. This shade is also beautiful when applied to my lips.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: This multi-stick is everything I had hoped for and more! I find it difficult to find a truly good cheek stain. One that blends effortlessly, looks rich and as a bonus looks youthful. This sheer buildable all in one is absolutely amazing. I’ll be buying every colour! ❤️

user_specs: ['Age 45-54', 'Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Nice for some quick color (cheeks, lips, eyes). I wish it wasn't quite so matte, but I add a little gloss over the lips. Blends pretty easily. A tiny bit darker than I like for summer. Glad I finally tried it; it's been in my favorites list for ages.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Hazel', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Medium', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: A nice alternative with less chemicals
review_content: I am always looking for good green cosmetics because I am careful what I put on my skin. I was a bit apprehensive about trying this product because I have not had good success with other cream or stick blushes but this one is very good. I plan to purchase several more

review_content: Very pretty color, I wanted to love this product! Despite being pretty sheer and emollient, it's very difficult to blend across skin and always seems to turn out patchy. Looks nice on lips but fades quickly.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content: Lady Bird is a cool, browny pink blush that goes on beautifully with a nice sheen. Very buildable, and fades very naturally over the course of the day. I love this line, although not all colours travel equally well between cheek, lips and eyes.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Dark', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Just what I was looking for. The color is very flattering for me. At first it looked a little bright but it goes on quite sheer. It has a dewy glowy finish that looks great. Easy to blend, but a bit harder to build the color. It is a natural flush of color.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Auburn', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Amazing and perfect on its own
review_content:
I have always been such a big fan of Ilia and this was just another product that I fell in love with. This product is definitely one that is more subtle, which I personally love because I can wear this with no foundation or tinted moisturizer and it looks natural and does not cake. I have oily acne prone skin, and it is also really sensitive so I was really happy to find this knowing that it was part of the "clean at sephora" line. Yes it is expensive, but I also do not cheap out on make up if I know it will not break me out or negatively affect my skin. If you are looking for something more pigmented, this is not for you, but if you are looking for something that is light to wear in the summer, or natural enough to wear on its own, it is for you! I wear this on my lids, lips and cheeks and I have never had a bad experience! It glides on so well and just looks beautiful.
